intro: Fornicium lyratum, commonly known as the lyrate fornicium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lyrate-shaped leaves, which are deeply lobed and resemble the shape of a lyre. Fornicium lyratum produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
